edu.rit.image

Class GrayPngWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.image.GrayPngWriter

  • public class GrayPngWriter
extends Object
    Class GrayPngWriter provides an object for writing an 8-bit grayscale PNG image. To write an image:

    1. Create an instance of class GrayPngWriter, specifying the image dimensions and the output stream to which to write the image.

    2. Optionally, call the writer's setPixelDimensions() method to set the pixels' physical size. If not specified, the default is 300×300 pixels per inch.

    3. Call the writer's getImageQueue() method to get the writer's image queue, which is an instance of class GrayImageQueue.

    4. Generate rows of pixel data and put them into the image queue by calling the image queue's put() method. Each row of pixel data must be stored in a GrayArray whose length is equal to the number of columns in the image. Each element of the array specifies the gray level for one pixel. You must call the image queue's put() method once for every row of pixels in the image. You do not have to put the rows in any particular order.

    5. Call the writer's write() method to write the pixel data to the PNG image.

    Steps 4 and 5 can be performed concurrently in separate threads. In Step 4, multiple threads can put the pixel data rows into the image queue concurrently.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GrayPngWriter

        public GrayPngWriter(int rows,
             int cols,
             OutputStream out)
        Construct a new grayscale PNG writer. The PNG image consists of the given number of rows and columns. The PNG image will be written to the given output stream.
        Parameters:
        rows - Number of rows. Must be ≥ 1.
        cols - Number of columns. Must be ≥ 1.
        out - Output stream.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if rows < 1 or cols < 1.
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if out is null.

    • Method Detail

      • setPixelDimensions

        public void setPixelDimensions(int xPpu,
                      int yPpu,
                      PixelUnit unit)
        Set this grayscale PNG writer's physical pixel dimensions to the given values. If not specified, the default is 300×300 pixels per inch.
        Parameters:
        xPpu - Pixels per unit, X axis.
        yPpu - Pixels per unit, Y axis.
        unit - Pixel dimension units.

      • getImageQueue

        public GrayImageQueue getImageQueue()
        Returns this grayscale PNG writer's image queue.
        Returns:
        Image queue.

      • write

        public void write()
           throws IOException,
                  InterruptedException
        Write this grayscale PNG writer's image to the underlying output stream. The pixel data is obtained from the image queue. The underlying output stream is closed once the image is written.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.
        InterruptedException - Thrown if the calling thread is interrupted while blocked in this method.
